t: Ezekiel 31
Egypt Cut Down Like a Great Tree
Now*p it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the third month,*i on the first day*i of the month, that*i the word of the Lord*s came to me, saying,
“Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his multitude: ‘Whom*pn are you like in your greatness?
Indeed*ld Assyria was*i a cedar in Lebanon, With*ld fine branches that shaded the forest, And*ld of high stature; And*ld its top was among the thick boughs.
The*ld waters made it grow; Underground*ld waters gave it height, With*ld their rivers running around the place where it was planted, And*ld sent out rivulets to all the trees of the field.
‘Therefore*ln its height was exalted above all the trees of the field; Its*ld boughs were multiplied, And*ld its branches became long because of the abundance of water, As*ld it sent them out.
All*ld the birds of the heavens made their nests in its boughs; Under*ld its branches all the beasts of the field brought forth their young; And*ld in its shadow all great nations made their home.
‘Thus*ln it was beautiful in greatness and in the length of its branches, Because*ld its roots reached to abundant waters.

The*ld cedars in the garden of God could not hide it; The*ld fir trees were not like its boughs, And*ld the chestnut trees were not like its branches; No*ld tree in the garden of God was like it in beauty.
I*ld made it beautiful with a multitude of branches, So*ld that all the trees of Eden envied it, That*ld were*i in the garden of God.’
“Therefore*p thus says the Lord God:*s ‘Because you have increased in height, and it set its top among the thick boughs, and its heart was lifted up in its height,
therefore I will deliver it into the hand of the mighty one of the nations, and he shall surely deal with it; I have driven it out for its wickedness.

And aliens, the most terrible of the nations, have cut it down and left it; its branches have fallen on the mountains and in all the valleys; its boughs lie broken by all the rivers of the land; and all the peoples of the earth have gone from under its shadow and left it.
‘On*pn its ruin will remain all the birds of the heavens, And*ld all the beasts of the field will come to its branches—

‘So*p that no trees by the waters may ever again exalt themselves for their height, nor set their tops among the thick boughs, that no tree which drinks water may ever be high enough to reach up to them. ‘For*pn they have all been delivered to death, To*ld the depths of the earth, Among*ld the children of men who go down to the Pit.’

“Thus*p says the Lord God:*s ‘In the day when it went down to hell, I caused mourning. I covered the deep because of it. I restrained its rivers, and the great waters were held back. I caused Lebanon to mourn for it, and all the trees of the field wilted because of it.

I made the nations shake at the sound of its fall, when I cast it down to hell together with those who descend into the Pit; and all the trees of Eden, the choice and best of Lebanon, all that drink water, were comforted in the depths of the earth.
They also went down to hell with it, with those slain by the sword; and those*i who*i were*i its strong*i arm dwelt in its shadows among the nations.

‘To*p which of the trees in Eden will you then be likened in glory and greatness? Yet you shall be brought down with the trees of Eden to the depths of the earth; you shall lie in the midst of the uncircumcised, with those*i slain by the sword. This is*i Pharaoh and all his multitude,’ says the Lord God.”*s
